greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of d*d' over all unordered pairs (d,d') with d*d' = n.
comment: a(n) is also the sum of all parts of all partitions of n into consecutive parts that differ by 2. - _Omar E. Pol_, May 05 2020
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: a(n) = n * ceiling( d(n)/2) where d is the number of divisors function.
G.f.: x*f'(x), where f(x) = Sum_{k>=1} x^k^2/(1 - x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 10 2017
example: a(4)=8 because pairs of factors are 1*4 and 2*2 and 1*4 + 2*2 = 8.

For n = 16 there are three partitions of 16 into consecutive parts that differ by 2 (including 16 as a valid partition). They are [16], [9, 7] and [7, 5, 3, 1]. The sum of the parts is [16] + [9 + 7] + [7 + 5 + 3 + 1] = 48, so a(16) = 48. - _Omar E. Pol_, May 05 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 04 2001
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 23 2001
